content: the instructions for body option 1 to complete rounds 14-19 stuff close the body and create the tail if you didn t attach the wings in round 13 sew them into place now you should end up with a finished body similar to the photo to compete the bird add eyes if you haven t already and a beak see page 12 **** 9 body option 3 seamless in this option you ll create the wings in position i used a contrasting yarn for clarity in this example but use whichever colour you like for this option the pattern is the same as option 1 except for rounds 9 10 and 13 round 1 to round 8 follow the instructions for body option 1 in round 9 you ll start working in row to build the wings round 9 single_crochet 1 increase single_crochet 3 chain 1 chain up 1 after stitch 6 work in the front loops only for the next 14 stitches double_crochet in the front loops only of the next 14 stitches chain 1 & turn double_crochet 14 along the row turn the work the first row of 14 dcs the second row of 14 dcs which completes the shoulder part of the wing now follow the instructions for the feathers page 2 instead of fastening off after completing the feathers chain 2 then make a slip_stitch into the front loop of stitch 20 of the round now complete the round in the remaining 5 stitches single_crochet 3 increase sc1 26 stitches in round 10 flip the wings over to keep them out of the way for the next few rounds round 10 single_crochet 1 increase single_crochet 4 sc14 in the back loops only single_crochet 4 increase single_crochet 1 28 single_crochet in back loops red completed round round 11 single_crochet around 28 round 12 single_crochet around make a shift stitch 28 round 13 follow the instructions for body option 2 to attach the wings at 3 points warning this can be fiddly if this step causes problems omit it and follow the round 13 instructions from option 1 instead you can then sew the wings into place after finishing the body round 14 to round 19 and tail follow the instructions for body option 1 to complete rounds 14-19 stuff close the body and create the tail if you didn t attach the wings in round 13 sew them into place now you should end up with a finished body similar to the photo to compete the bird add eyes if you haven t already and a beak see page 12 **** 11 eyes & beak the bird can be customised with any shape or size of beak you like but below is the method i use to create a simple small beak with some scrap yarn 1 mark the centre of the body 2 make a stitch inserting the 3 insert the needle under the with a pin between rounds 4 needle just to
